description: This course builds on English Writing and Research Methods courses, which are a pre-requisite, and is designed to guide students through the initial process of writing their MA thesis. More specifically, it explains to students how to select sources, organize and complete their book list, locate an adviser, start working with the adviser, complete their research proposal and defend the proposal hearing. Through weekly writing assignments, peer review and class discussion, this class provides insight on writing a MA dissertation, while also assisting students with their current writing and research methodology challenges.
goals: to plan the chapter structure of the MA dissertation
Offer insight and guidance to students’ writing and research methodology
